articles.headline: Steven Mnuchin, Treasury Nominee, Failed to Disclose $100 Million in Assets
articles.snippet: Mr. Mnuchin, who is testifying before the Senate Finance Committee, also did not list his role as a director of an investment fund in the Cayman Islands on a questionnaire.
articles.abstract: Mr. Mnuchin, who is testifying before the Senate Finance Committee, also did not list his role as a director of an investment fund in the Cayman Islands on a questionnaire.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Steven T. Mnuchin, President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick to be Treasury secretary, failed to disclose nearly $100 million of his assets on Senate Finance Committee disclosure documents and forgot to mention his role as a director of an investment fund located in a tax haven, an omission that Democrats said made him unfit to serve in one of the government’s most important positions.

articles.headline: C.I.A. Torture Detailed in Newly Disclosed Documents
articles.snippet: The material sheds additional light on the torture program as the future of the Senate’s classified full report on it hangs in the balance with the Obama presidency ending.
articles.abstract: The material sheds additional light on the torture program as the future of the Senate’s classified full report on it hangs in the balance with the Obama presidency ending.
articles.lead_paragraph: When C.I.A. interrogators in a Thailand prison sent a cable to agency headquarters recounting that they had been slamming Abu Zubaydah, a captured terrorism suspect, against a wall, they emphasized that they were obeying instructions to take steps to prevent his injury, like putting a rolled-up towel behind his neck, and described the practice in detached terms.
articles.byline: By Sheri Fink, James Risen and Charlie Savage

articles.headline: At Trump Hotel in Washington, Champagne Toasts in an Ethical ‘Minefield’
articles.snippet: From the moment he is sworn in, the new president, Donald J. Trump, may be in violation of a lease with the federal government.
articles.abstract: From the moment he is sworn in, the new president, Donald J. Trump, may be in violation of a lease with the federal government.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With sirens blaring, a fleet of limousines and security personnel raced down Pennsylvania Avenue twice in less than 24 hours to deliver Donald J. Trump to inauguration events.
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton and Susanne Craig

articles.headline: Women’s March Draws ‘Duty-Bound’ From Wall Street
articles.snippet: Financial professionals, not known for political protest because of its potential to hurt their careers, are joining the Washington event in force.
articles.abstract: Financial professionals, not known for political protest because of its potential to hurt their careers, are joining the Washington event in force.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hillary Ripley was on a stair climber at her Brooklyn gym when her 16-year-old daughter texted.

articles.headline: Tesla’s Self-Driving System Cleared in Deadly Crash
articles.snippet: The highway agency found that while Tesla’s Autopilot feature didn’t prevent a crash in Florida, the system performed as it was intended.
articles.abstract: The highway agency found that while Tesla’s Autopilot feature didn’t prevent a crash in Florida, the system performed as it was intended.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eight months after a fatal crash involving a Tesla Motors car operating in a computer-assisted mode, federal auto-safety regulators said their investigation of the car found no defects in the system that caused the accident and said Tesla’s Autopilot-enabled vehicles did not need to be recalled.

articles.headline: In Navient Lawsuits, Unsettling Echoes of Past Lending Crisis
articles.snippet: The largest U.S. collector of student loan payments is accused of engaging in the sloppiness and misleading tactics seen in the subprime market.
articles.abstract: The largest U.S. collector of student loan payments is accused of engaging in the sloppiness and misleading tactics seen in the subprime market.
articles.lead_paragraph: A man in Boston rolled several student loans into one, and his balance doubled overnight, with no explanation.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Stacy Cowley

articles.headline: Issues of Riches Trip Up Steven Mnuchin and Other Nominees
articles.snippet: Mr. Mnuchin, who failed to disclose nearly $100 million in assets, said the disclosure forms were “complicated” and his omissions were “unintentional.”
articles.abstract: Mr. Mnuchin, who failed to disclose nearly $100 million in assets, said the disclosure forms were “complicated” and his omissions were “unintentional.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Steven T. Mnuchin, President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick to head the Treasury Department, came under withering fire on Thursday for foreclosing on homes in California, managing an offshore investment account and initially failing to disclose almost $100 million in assets.

articles.headline: Trump Nominees Make Clear Plans to Sweep Away Obama Policies
articles.snippet: Over two weeks of hearings, Donald J. Trump’s cabinet picks have strongly embraced a deeply conservative approach to governing.
articles.abstract: Over two weeks of hearings, Donald J. Trump’s cabinet picks have strongly embraced a deeply conservative approach to governing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump’s cabinet nominees, while moderating some of their stances, have made it clear during two weeks of hearings that they intend to work hard to sweep away President Obama’s domestic policy by embracing a deeply conservative approach to governing.

articles.headline: Intercepted Russian Communications Part of Inquiry Into Trump Associates
articles.snippet: It is not clear whether the communications had anything to do with Donald J. Trump or his campaign.
articles.abstract: It is not clear whether the communications had anything to do with Donald J. Trump or his campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American law enforcement and intelligence agencies are examining intercepted communications and financial transactions as part of a broad investigation into possible links between Russian officials and associates of President-elect Donald J. Trump, including his former campaign chairman Paul Manafort, current and former senior American officials said.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt, Matthew Rosenberg, Adam Goldman and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: A Gathering of the Global Elite, Through a Woman’s Eyes
articles.snippet: Following a behavioral economist from Harvard as she navigates the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, where 80 percent of the participants are men.
articles.abstract: Following a behavioral economist from Harvard as she navigates the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, where 80 percent of the participants are men.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAVOS, Switzerland — Iris Bohnet navigates the narrow carpeted stairs to the wood-paneled hotel lobby balancing a smartphone, two bags and a winter coat the size of a duvet. It’s below freezing here. She’s been up for an hour already, checking emails and sending a quick note to her husband, who is looking after their two boys, but mostly, she admits, blow-drying her hair. This is her first observation of the day: Davos Woman gets less sleep than Davos Man because of her hair.

articles.headline: 6 Tips for Avoiding the Worst Student Loan Repayment Traps
articles.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau accused Navient, the nation’s largest student loan servicer, of much wrongdoing. Here’s how to steer clear of problems.
articles.abstract: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau accused Navient, the nation’s largest student loan servicer, of much wrongdoing. Here’s how to steer clear of problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: Whether or not you believe the allegations, the jaw-dropping dossier of sins that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau accuses the nation’s largest student loan servicer of committing is useful for two crucial reasons.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Is Sworn In as President, Capping His Swift Ascent
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump was inaugurated as the 45th president of the United States after one of the most divisive election campaigns in modern times.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump was inaugurated as the 45th president of the United States after one of the most divisive election campaigns in modern times.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Donald John Trump was inaugurated as the 45th president of the United States on Friday, ushering in a new era that he vowed would shatter the established order and reverse a national decline that he called “this American carnage.”
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Michael D. Shear
